raw: * Normalization for pointer events. Pointer events are hardware-agnostic and
* will be fired regardless of which input type of input device is used (e.g. mouse or touchscreen).
* @require(qx.module.Event)
* @require(qx.module.event.Pointer#getPointerType) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced
* @require(qx.module.event.Pointer#getViewportLeft) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced
* @require(qx.module.event.Pointer#getViewportTop) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced
* @require(qx.module.event.Pointer#getDocumentLeft) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced
* @require(qx.module.event.Pointer#getDocumentTop) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced
* @require(qx.module.event.Pointer#getScreenLeft) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced
* @require(qx.module.event.Pointer#getScreenTop) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced
* @group (Event_Normalization)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Normalization for pointer events. Pointer events are hardware-agnostic and will be fired regardless of which input type of input device is used (e.g. mouse or touchscreen).

raw: * List of event types to be normalized

@description.name: @description
@description.body: List of event types to be normalized

raw: * Returns the device type which the event triggered. This can be one
* of the following strings: mouse, pen
* or touch.
* @return {String} The type of the pointer.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the device type which the event triggered. This can be one of the following strings: mouse, pen or touch.

raw: * Get the horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative
* to the viewport.
* @return {Number} The horizontal mouse position

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the viewport.

raw: * Get the vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative
* to the viewport.
* @return {Number} The vertical mouse position
* @signature function()

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the viewport.

raw: * Get the horizontal position at which the event occurred relative to the
* left of the document. This property takes into account any scrolling of
* the page.
* @return {Number} The horizontal mouse position in the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the horizontal position at which the event occurred relative to the left of the document. This property takes into account any scrolling of the page.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The horizontal mouse position in the document.
@return.description: The horizontal mouse position in the document.

raw: * Get the vertical position at which the event occurred relative to the
* top of the document. This property takes into account any scrolling of
* the page.
* @return {Number} The vertical mouse position in the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the vertical position at which the event occurred relative to the top of the document. This property takes into account any scrolling of the page.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The vertical mouse position in the document.
@return.description: The vertical mouse position in the document.

raw: * Get the horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to
* the origin of the screen coordinate system.
* Note: This value is usually not very useful unless you want to
* position a native popup window at this coordinate.
* @return {Number} The horizontal mouse position on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the origin of the screen coordinate system. Note: This value is usually not very useful unless you want to position a native popup window at this coordinate.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The horizontal mouse position on the screen.
@return.description: The horizontal mouse position on the screen.

raw: * Get the vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to
* the origin of the screen coordinate system.
* Note: This value is usually not very useful unless you want to
* position a native popup window at this coordinate.
* @return {Number} The vertical mouse position on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to the origin of the screen coordinate system. Note: This value is usually not very useful unless you want to position a native popup window at this coordinate.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The vertical mouse position on the screen.
@return.description: The vertical mouse position on the screen.

raw: * Manipulates the native event object, adding methods if they're not
* already present
* @param event {Event} Native event object
* @param element {Element} DOM element the listener was attached to
* @return {Event} Normalized event object
* @internal

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Manipulates the native event object, adding methods if they're not already present

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} DOM element the listener was attached to
@param.description: DOM element the listener was attached to
